Zahi Hawass said now that the Egyptian Museum's collection was secure from thieves, the greatest threat to the collection inside was posed by the torched ruling party headquarters building next door. What scares me is that if this building is destroyed, it will fall over the museum, Zahi Hawass said as he watched fire trucks spray water on the still-smoldering NDP headquarters. And then, finally, when President Bush could avoid it no longer, he mentioned Dick Cheney , damning with faint praise: Dick Cheney 's advice was consistent and strong.
